title: Electric flux - flux-vs-r graph for point charge

content.question: A positive point charge is located at the center of a sphere of variable radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math>. Which of the following graphs indicates the electric flux through the surface of the sphere as a function of its radius?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “r,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Electric Flux.” The line begins on the vertical axis toward the top and moves horizontally to the right.
The figure shows the graph of a line in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “r,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Electric Flux.” The line begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “r,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Electric Flux.” The curve begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “r,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Electric Flux.” The curve begins to the right of the top of the vertical axis and moves downward and to the right, steeply at first and then more gradually.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a line in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “r,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Electric Flux.” The line begins on the vertical axis toward the top and moves horizontally to the right.
